expert, food writer, and dynamic television personality. Since the show\u2019s inception in 2006, she has lent her extensive expertise as a permanent judge on Bravo\u2019s Emmy-winning series Top Chef. Now entering its eleventh successful season, Top Chef is rated the #1 food show on cable television. Gail is also the new head critic on Top Chef Masters, airing this summer, and was previously host of Top Chef Just Desserts, Bravo\u2019s pastry-focused spin-off of the Top Chef franchise. Born and raised in Toronto, Canada, Gail moved to New York City in 1999 to attend culinary school at what is now the Institute of Culinary Education. She then trained in the kitchens of legendary Le Cirque 2000 and groundbreaking Vong restaurants, and worked for esteemed food critic Jeffrey Steingarten at Vogue. Gail joined Food &amp; Wine in 2004 and directs special projects for the magazine, acting as liaison between the marketing and editorial teams on magazine events and chef-related initiatives, working closely with the country\u2019s top culinary talent. | The best piece of advice I ever got was:\u00a0keep your mouth shut so you learn how to listen, but open it enough so you learn how to taste.", "sameAs": ["http://gailsimmons.com/", "https://x.com/jennifer-davidson"], "mainEntityOfPage": {"@id": "https://www.thefashionspot.com/author/gail-simmons/"}}]}]

In her personal life,\u00a0Jessica favors a silhouette that is clean and minimalist, yet chic, beautiful and sexy. Her color palette includes plenty of black with bold splashes of bright color.\u00a0 In addition to her celebrity clientele, Jessica is the Chief Stylist for JustFab.com.", "mainEntityOfPage": {"@id": "https://www.thefashionspot.com/author/jessica-paster/"}}]}]

In addition, Alice Roi was nominated for the Cooper Hewitt design award. The Alice Roi collection was instantly picked up by one of the leading independent stores in New York, Kirna Zabete.
